SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: You found us!

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: Yay!

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: I’m Em.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: I did all the sound design in this game!

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: Which means I recorded and edited voices,| ambiences,| footsteps...

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: and a whole bunch of silliness.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: I’m really grateful to have had the chance to be a part of Wandersong.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: I think it’s really special.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: And I’m so happy to have helped add something so positive to the world.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: I’m also super grateful that you’ve taken the time to play it.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: I hope you’ve enjoyed listening!

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: We all put a lot of energy and love into how this game sounds.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: I think it’s a really important part of storytelling.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: And that it can add so much value

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: to listen.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: So it means a lot to me to have been able to work with Greg,

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: who really cared about it

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: right from the start!

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: We had a lot of fun making it together.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: It feels crazy now

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: to be letting it all go.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: All I hope, in the end

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: is that you’ve kept some of the feeling

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: that we shook out of our hearts.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: I hope that it feels good. <3

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: Wandersong was the first game I worked on!

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: Way back in 2016

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: It’s what got me started in indie games.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: I’ve worked on a few since then

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: but this one has been my biggest constant.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: It’s also the one closest to my heart.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: The themes that Greg explores really resonate with me.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: And I think they’re super important ideas to spread right now.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: So it’s been wonderful to contribute to that.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: For me it’s pretty interesting to look back

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: From the beginning

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: all the way to the end

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: and hear how the sound changes.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: It was really easy to grow with this game

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: because we made each act a different theme sonically.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: There was a lot of experimentation!

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: Time for some fun facts!

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: There are 5|0|8|4|| sounds

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: That’s a lot for an indie game!

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: Greg and I voiced most of the characters.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: Most of the sounds are recorded.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: So many of those sounds are my voice.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: A lot of the ambiences shift depending on where you are.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: There are so so many silly details.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: So silly.

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: Well...

SPEAKER: objEm
ENGLISH: Thanks for listening.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Hey,| I'm Greg.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I made this game!

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: It's really great to meet you!

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Did you really figure out how to get here yourself?

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Did you look it up on the internet?

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: It's OK if you did.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Either way,| I have a lot to say to you.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I'm really touched that you came this far.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: From the bottom of my heart...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I want to say THANK YOU.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: THANK YOU for playing!!!

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: This game means a lot to me.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I put a lot of love,| thought and effort into it.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And it's really special...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: To make something like that| and share it with someone.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I genuinely hope you enjoyed it.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: As I'm writing this,| I have no idea...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: What will happen when the game comes out.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I don't know how many people will ever play it...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Or if anyone will ever even find this message.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: But if there's even one person who cares about the game...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: That makes it worth it,| to me.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: So,| I guess it's not just "Thanks for playing"...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: But|| thanks| for caring.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I hope someday...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: You can make something too,| and share it.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: It's so important to express yourself.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And the world needs to hear your voice!

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: You can do it.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: You are special!

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And you deserve love.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I really believe that.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: You can hang out here as long as you want.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: If you keep chatting with me,

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I'm gonna talk about what it was like making the game.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: If that's interesting to you at all!

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Before I started Wandersong,

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I lived on my bicycle for 5 months and rode across the USA.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Along the way I met lots of people...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And did something I didn't think I could!

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I was feeling really optimisitc about life and humanity.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And I wanted to make a game to express that...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: The first thing I made was the rainbow music wheel.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Just that,| floating in an empty void.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I wanted to make a controller into a musical instrument,

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And make it feel as natural and fun as possible.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: When I saw it worked,| more ideas started coming to me...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Then started pouring like a waterfall...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: It took me a while to nail down the story.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I had a plot in mind for a while,| but it was missing something...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Then I had an epiphany one day,

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And the idea of the Earthsong came to me.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I remember crying a little bit when it did.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: That was the key to unlocking the shape of the story.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: My original plot idea became just Act 5.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And the world of Wandersong started to take shape.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Act 1 came together within a few months.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I've made countless changes to it since then...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: But it was basically the same as now.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: My friends played it and thought it had potential.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: What I needed was sounds,| and music.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I tried recording my voice to make all the sounds...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And I wrote some songs too.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: But the game was asking for better than I could give it.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Simply put,| I realized the audio had to be amazing.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Which meant I needed money.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: So I put it on Kickstarter.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: The response on Kickstarter was really wonderful.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Everyone was so enthusiastic!

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: The game quickly had more fan art than anything else I'd done.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: There were many musicians asking to work with me.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: It felt very special...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Even so,| I didn't know if I'd make it until the very end.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And when I did...| it felt like a miracle.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Every step of the way,

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I felt like I was doing something a little too big for myself.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And then just narrowly making it.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: ||It felt |powerful...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I met Gordon through some friends.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: His music for Parkitect had a really good vibe...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: He really believed in Wandersong,| despite the modest funds and huge idea.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And he was local!| So we could work closely together.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: After a long search,| I'd found my musician.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Em was his first hiree,| and Wandersong was her first game.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: She brought so much enthusiasm into the game...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: It bowled me over.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: So,| we got to work.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: We made the game almost perfectly sequentially,

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Act by act.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I would rush ahead,| developing gameplay and writing scenes.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Then Em would breathe life into the game with audio.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Gord was busy at first with other commitments...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: But he did eventually catch up.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: It took almost 2 years to work to the ending of the game.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And then more months of refining,| polishing and fixing.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: I could talk forever about this.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: It took over my entire life,| for 3 years...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: But I'm going to stop here for now.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Thanks for listening.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: We went and added some commentary notes to scenes in the game.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: Look out for those if you want to learn more!

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: And...

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: {size 2}THANKS FOR PLAYING

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: {}It really means so much to me.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: More than I can put into words.

SPEAKER: objGreg
ENGLISH: {color red}{size 2}0

DEV COMMENTARY, UNLOCKED AFTER BEATING THE GAME

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After the game systems were kinda working,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The first thing I made was the intro.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But the original intro was really bad.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: A star landed by the bard's house,| and you walked to it up a hill...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: (A lot like in Earthbound...)

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And then the angel gave you a spiel about the world ending

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was just very...|| plain...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It didn't change until I finished Act 1,| and this new idea came to me all at once.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think it expresses the values of the game pretty concisely.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And it cemented how huge a part the Hero would have to play in the story.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Until then,| I was undecided on her role.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: You'd be surprised how little this changed from my first design.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: A bird,| singing 3 notes,| with the two ledges...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But there were a million tiny changes to make it work

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The bird animations,| the UI,| the notes it sings...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The note detection,| the spacing,| the timing...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It took |MANY| tries and tests and adjustments for players to understand this puzzle.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This is maybe the most crucial screen in the game...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's the first real test of all the game controls...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It sets the pace for all the puzzles and gameplay to come...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And it solidifies the idea of "musical gameplay" in the player's mind

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was important to establish early on that you could sing melodies.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The ghost fights reinforce that too.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Later on,| the gameplay gets more abstract...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But the player always understands that they're singing songs.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I decided I needed to put something interactable on this ledge...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So the player would jump up to it,| and learn how layers worked.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: At the time Miriam was one of the only other characters designed.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I didn't yet know her story,| or how far she'd go.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I had some ideas on the spot,| wrote some lines and stuck her here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I don't think I've edited them since!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Most of Act 1 was rewritten many times,| in contrast.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But Miriam had a clear voice right away.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I love Clyde.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I named Langtree after "Langtry,"

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Which is a tiny tiny town in Texas that I slept in on my bike trip.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's in the middle of the desert,| far from civilization...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It used to be a rail town,| but trains don't go there anymore.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And there were only a few people living there.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But they remarked about how they loved the peace and solitude.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I thought that was inspiring.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The town itself was named after an old famed actress named Lillie Langtry,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And she was |ALSO| the namesake of Miss Langtry,| the lovestruck schoolteacher,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: In "Over the Garden Wall,"| one of this game's biggest creative inpirations.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I didn't know that until later.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But there's something full circle about it,| isn't there?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It seems like the ghosts are just singing random patterns...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I actually hand-wrote every 3 note sequence that sounded right.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I also seperated them into hard and easy patterns...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: If you wait a while,| the ghosts start doing more easy ones.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We added dancing very late in development.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was animating them up until the last few weeks.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And it took a long time to realize the Mask would teach them.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Until then,| he was just a sagely character who mysteriously appeared everywhere...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was a good moment where two disconnected ideas completed one another.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This puzzle was a doozy to make work for players.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It tests very particular knowledge about how the game elements interact.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I came back late in development and added more screens prior to this,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Just to really reinforce everything at play here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think it's a fun puzzle.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: ...|But I'm still not 100% sure if it was right to include in this game

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: What do you think?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Early on I thought there would be many more puzzles like this.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: There's a great feature I never got to make use of,| actually...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Multiple birds can follow you,| and each give you 1 big jump.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So there could have been a screen,| where,| for example...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: You have to run around and collect birds without jumping...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And then climb a really tall tower with a chain of bird jumps.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Sounds fun on paper!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I slowly learned this game was more fun when it was less "brainy."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This song was originally written for the prologue.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But we came back and replaced it with the Hero melody when that was written.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It fits way better here,| anyway!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Also,| this screen was totally based on the one at the end of Wind Waker...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Where Zelda is sleeping in a bed like this,| just before you fight Ganon.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think it's really funny to image the Roi des Rêves as a sleeping princess.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And this ended up being the reference for our final boss room,| too.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I first envisioned the Roi des Rêves as a big fluffy friendly cat.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Kind of a "My Neighbor Totoro" vibe...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That would have been so boring though.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: When I first considered that he'd turn you down...| I got very excited.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Although I didn't fully know what it would mean,| yet.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Also...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Did you know you can come back and ring the bell again after he kicks you out?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I really enjoyed making this screen.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The idea to name the bard here was something I decided on the spot,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After it came up organically in the conversation.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I decided at some point the bard's canon name would be "Kiwi,"

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After a novelty tea called "Kiwi's Big Adventure," which I almost named the game after.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I made sure that was a possibility...| along with others.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Miriam is the only one who refers to you by your chosen name though.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: In fact...|!!!|| Did you know...?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: No two characters refer to you by same name.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's true!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had a lot of fun coming up with different nicknames for you.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Delphi is named after Philadelphia,| the city where I grew up.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I really love Philly.| It's a special place.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It also inspired the autumn colors and some of the personalities.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Manny really feels like a Philly guy to me.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: There's a musician I like very much called Slow Magic.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: He was the first inspiration for the Mask character...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I was at one of his concerts when I had the plot idea for Act 2.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: A great concert really does set your soul on fire.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Viola was the first character I designed for the game after the bard.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The name is pretty on the nose,| isn't it?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think I just named her game object after the instrument she was holding.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: As a "temporary" thing until I came up with a name.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: You see where that got us.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think she would laugh about it if you mentioned it to her.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: {font 3}"Mhm!|| That's how you know I was born to perform!"

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Ash was designed by my very good friend Noel Berry.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Used with his permission...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I don't think he even remembers making them.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They were the lead character in an "Inktober" serial comic we were making together.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It opened with them playing music to their mentor's gravestone,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And their mentor's ghost rose from the grave and joined in.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I thought that was a powerful scene...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I lifted that too ;)

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: As a dog might say,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Getting the performance working was pretty...|| "Ruff!"

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wanted the player to feel like they were leading the song.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And that also meant not enforcing any particular rhythm on their gameplay!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: There couldn't be a failure state,| or any way to "miss."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was adamant about this!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It basically meant the song needed a million layers.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It responds to you,| and sounds right regardless of what you do.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It did not come easy for us.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I remember I was on the phone with Gord,| sorting out all the pieces we needed.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was a very frazzled phone call.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I promised him, "we just need to do this once, and never again."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We simply couldn't make this game without something like this segment.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It fulfills the promise of Wandersong.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We called this song "Wannabe" internally.| I wrote it!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: A few songs were made that way.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wrote something simple,| then Gord would spice it up and build on it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After Gord did this version,| we decided to make it the Hero's theme.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: There's something apt about the bard introducing it as their breakout musical number,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Where they finally reveal their true desires...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Only to have it stolen from them by the actual Hero.| Ouch!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After that,| we went back and hid this song in the prologue too.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's intentional that you hear this one before even the bard's theme.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Act 2's all about wind.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: In the beginning,| with the troll,| you sing against it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Then,| with the band,| you sing with it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And then in the spirit world,| you guide it yourself!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: {shake}I |||LOVE||| PIRATES

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This color palette was inspired by Mango and Melon-flavored Melona bars,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Which I ate all summer while making this act.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They're super sweet and creamy ice cream bars from Korea.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The first time I had them,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: My first reaction was anger.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was already in my 20s and I'd wasted so much time not eating them.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: You know,| in the game Earthbound...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: (One of my very favorite games ever...)

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: In the english translation,| they replaced a bar with a coffee shop.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And all the adults talk about how you're too young for "coffee,"| etc.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wanted to run farther with that idea.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: No rum for these pirates!| They're all about coffee!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think it's a good message for the kids.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But coffee also keeps you alert through the dark ocean night!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And it's a very valuable crop to sell!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It really makes sense,| doesn't it?

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They were the team spellcaster and could do all kinds of crazy magic.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Actually,| I've just decided that in Wandersong that's canon.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Yes.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: For my birthday one year,| my mom drew me a Wandersong fan art.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Thanks mom!

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was |THIS| close to making a menu screen for it!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I even started coding it a little before I caught myself and was like,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: {shake}"Wait,| what am I doing???"{/shake}

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Can you imagine how boring that would have been?

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And then wins them over with a jaunty song!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And teaches them the values of silliness and joy!!!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's a classic scene from lots of "naive character on a journey" films.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I struggled with how to make it work with the plot.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I toned it down...| if you sang here,| the pirates would sing along.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I even wrote lyrics for them to sing!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was how you discovered the location of one of the islands.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But players were |NOT| organically finding it...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So |THEN,| I decided it would be |OPTIONAL!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And no lyics!| Those weren't working well either.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So just,| if you sang in this room,| the characters would react and sing as well.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And it was too much work to record that voiceover for something optional.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And,| it was a good call.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: ||But I still wonder what could have been...

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But it's in there,| all right.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I don't know exactly where it came from.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I had |SO| much fun asking Gord to make a chiptune ska song.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We spent a day listening to cheesy 90's ska together and getting inspired.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think this really exemplifies the best aspects of Wandersong.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Making things up as I went and trying to surprise myself.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That's the kind of energy indie games naturally tap into.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I had to be very patient to use it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But at this point the player was finally ready for this kind of thing.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Now the roots were set.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After this,| it felt like I was allowed to do anything with the singing.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Markus is just,| like...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: What if toxic masculinity was fully self aware,| and still wanted to be itself?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I've known people like this...| it's not pretty.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think there's something inherently destructive in the "hero quest" mentality...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: At least in the way I see it applied in media these days.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Hmmm...| I'm getting a bit off the rails here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: There's actually 3 different ways to "win" this situation.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I originally only intended the one where you drink coffee and sing Markus off.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I took so much time to introduce that at the start of the act!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But then I kept finding other interesting interactions.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Also,| I should have reminded the player sometime about the coffee thing...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think that's a Checkhov's gun storytelling rule I messed up on.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I started making the footsteps sounds with my mouth while animating the captain's walk.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And then I knew.|| It was just too good.|| It HAD to be the sound.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'm so grateful to have worked on a game where I was allowed to do this.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Actually,| I feel that way about a lot of this game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Speaking of toxic masculinity and its relationship to quests and heroes...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Captain Lucas is the total epitome of that entanglement,| isn't he?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: He saw a beautiful woman like,| once...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And now he's on a quest for her love,| like it's a prize to win,| and he HAS to have her...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Gross,| right???

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But when she turns him down,| at least he has the grace to back off.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: In the long run,| he cares about her desires as much as his own.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That makes him more redeemable than Markus.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I really enjoy how the visual design of this place came out.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I never figured it out.

ENGLISH: I liked how this looked,| though.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I decided to just re-use this one!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It has a good "ominous" feeling.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Before you make something new,| you should always think about what you can re-use!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think that's a great rule of thmb.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Act 3 was supposed to be about waves,| and space.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The idea loosely translated into changing the shape of these things...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: As a way of kinda "distorting space."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The shapes are actually totally defined by sinewaves too.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: With unique wave offsets and periods and amplitudes written in.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Act 3 is also about chaos.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wanted these things to be confusing and inconsistent.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So you had to just sing randomly at them and guess what shape they'd take.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: (Or semi-random...| there's a pattern guiding how the notes are picked.)

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This whole section is meant to be a bit frustrating.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It doesn't feel "made for you."

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Like they don't belong here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This section was a HUGE amount of effort,| especially for how small it is.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: {shake}TOTALLY WORTH IT THOUGH!{/shake}

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'd been looking forward to this for a very long time.

ENGLISH: I really thought a lot about Audrey's gameplay...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wanted it to be strong enough to believably support an entire other game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary

ENGLISH: Did you know she even has a dash/dodge manuever?

SPEAKER: objCommentary

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But as time passes,| they're all getting bigger and stronger.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So each one she fights is always stronger than the last.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I really didn't want to do any more of this gameplay than necessary.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I sure was tempted.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: There are so many ways I could have built on it...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I really enjoy the mechanic of hitting projectiles with the sword,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And aiming them different directions based on the angle you hit it at.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I thought about hiding a golf game using that somewhere...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: {}From concept to final execution,| Act 4 changed the most by a very long shot.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I always knew it would be about the bard overcoming sadness.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But the original setting was a tiny,| tiny village in the snow.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was going to be a lot more "holiday" themed...| fairy lights everywhere...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And the bard was going to be cheered up by the holiday spirit!!!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I always had in mind that this act would have a "time" theme.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I had no idea how that would translate into the town gameplay.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That is,| until Stardew Valley came out,| just as I was starting Act 4.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I could never get into it,| myself...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But once I'd thought about scheduled gameplay, I couldn't get it out of my head.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was just such a weird,| out of left field,| pie-in-the-sky idea...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had to try it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It ended up being the most unnecessarily complicated thing in the entire game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Writing a day/night NPC schedule is not,| like...||| easy.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I did it all just for one tiny piece of this game!!!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Right after I made an entire action game section!!!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I hope it at least made an impact...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had no idea Peter was going to be in love with Miriam until I wrote his first conversation.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And then it just seemed...| obvious,| for some reason.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I also had no idea Miriam was going to reciprocate until I wrote |HER| conversation.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was on a rollercoaster,| right there with the player on this one.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We use the "whisper" singing voice in lots of places in the game...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But Act 4 is the actual reason we went through with recording it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was not easy!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We asked a lot of our performer,| John Robert Matz.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And he really came through!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This act has so much more power for it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The bard losing their singing voice is a loss you can really feel.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This bit was one of the few big ideas I had very early on.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I thought it would be in a kind of lighthearted Santa's toy shop.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: All the elves would be depressed,| and unable to make toys...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But the bard would run around and cheer them up,| one by one.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And they'd sing along,| and activate musical toy-making machines,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Building up the song to a huge joyful power ballad!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: A lot of this act's premise came about to build up to that gameplay.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But wow,| the vibe of this whole act shifted a lot under that idea.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It took me a long time to sort that out.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So this particular section actually changed a lot right at the end.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: For most of development,| everyone in the factory started out not working,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And when the bard "activated" them,| they'd start working the machines.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Which made,| uh...|| no sense at all.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'm glad I had time to revisit it again.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This is the only remains of the original "holiday" idea I had for Act 4.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's hard to overstate just how much this act changed from my first idea.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I love it way more this way though.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This act had a couple big changes right at the end.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had a lot of confused ideas about the "message" and how to communicate it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: One big issue was...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It didn't make sense to recruit unemployed people to overthrow the factory.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After all,| everyone in the town complains about it nonstop.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So wouldn't it make more sense to get people already on the "inside"?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I thought about changing it so that all the workers were brainwashed...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: As if the factory turned them into robots or something...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It would have been creepy...| and made the conflict a lot more "obvious."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I was committed to keeping everybody's individual personality.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That's just such a huge part of the Wandersong experience.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I didn't want to reduce people to just being "brainwashed"...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Because in reality,| as I tried to explore here a little bit too,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Bad things are actually enabled by free-thinking,| well-meaning people!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So instead I added new dialog for every character,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Explaining directly why they wouldn't help you overthrow it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That really helped to untie an emotional knot in the story.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I thought a lot about building a "skinner box" into the game via the factory.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Something totally exploitive,| with all the classic free-to-play app garbage...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Some friends even made a |(funny)| case to include in-app purchases and profit off it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But it was just too evil...|| I couldn't bring myself to do it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I guess it's saying something that I could do the violent hero stuff,| but not that.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: What's in the game is meant to evoke that,| but much more toned down.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It does really tie well with the themes of meaningless happiness...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We did a lot of things to push the "time" aspect of the gameplay.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: All characters animate very distinctly on the beat...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And cutscene events like pauses and animation changes are altered to happen on the beat as well.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We wanted the whole town to feel like clockwork.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I really really like how the colors out here look during sunset.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This town ended up taking on kind of a Majora's Mask vibe.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So it felt very natural to work an astronomer into the plot.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: She ended up being the only "scientific" character in the game...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I enjoyed her interactions with the bard and the silly magic that rules her universe.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I really was feeling for Miriam by this part.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: She had ambitions to be the hero of her own story...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But she ended up being just the hint guide for you.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think in a small way,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: She helps the bard contextualize their own loss of not being the hero.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: If we're always looking up,| we erase the people stuck below us.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was excited about doing this gameplay for a long time!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's probably the most "hardcore" part of the game...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: There were times when I was worried I went too far with it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I think it feels intense and frustrating in a good way.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's your first venture into the spirit world after being exlicitly told you don't belong.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So now the world feels especially ambivalent towards you.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This spirit world went through the most revisions by far.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It took |MANY| tries just to tune the clock gameplay...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Originally I wanted it to be a lot more "squishy"...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Let the player spin it any speed,| and control the speed of time precisely.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But that was waaayyy too confusing...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It took a long time to figure out the visual indications.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The last big change we made was the world changing color with the direction of time.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That made it feel a lot more cool!|| It seemed obvious in retrospect.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Once I gave players control of the speed of time...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was really hard to give them a reason to ever make it fast.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Slower is always easier...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But if the answer is always to go slower,| you'd never change it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And changing it is really cool!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: ...|So that's why these things exist.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I didn't expect anyone to ever get this,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But the "waiting in line" was inspired by the waterfall puzzle in Earthbound...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We had so much fun making the song for the "waiting room."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was inspired after that to give the Order Fairy their little dances.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Incidentally,| the song Gord wrote ended up being exactly 69 seconds long.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That's why the Order Fairy says "nice!" at the end.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was figuring out a lot as I went here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I didn't know Miriam and the Hero would fight until just as I started writing this scene.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was very conflicted about it!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I felt I was pushing the boundary of what Wandersong was allowed to be.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had |SO| many ideas for Queen Order I didn't get to use.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: She was one of the very first characters I sketched for the game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: She's crazy addicted to tea and has an intense fixation on schedule.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But the plot had too many other demands at this point.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The scene at the end here called for every major character to return...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And we had too much ground to cover.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Sorry, Queen Order.| Maybe next time...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The plot of Act 5 was originally my idea for the entire game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After I came up with the Earthsong,| it made more sense as a sub-story...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But that's probably why it ended up so huge.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: There was no getting around it...| the story demanded something epic.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After dragging myself out of Act 4,| which was full of technical challenges...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I thought I would try to push through this one quickly.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wasn't prepared for it at all,| to be honest.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had a lot of creative challenges putting it together.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I excitedly made this part knowing it was the {wiggle}final ghost battle{/wiggle}

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I'd already been working on the game long enough...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: ...that I felt nostalgic about earlier acts.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So it starts as a callback to the Act 1 ghosts!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And then evolves to weird new stuff along a similiar idea.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It really shows how well trained the player is at singing by now.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Also,| when I made this bit,| I didn't yet know who Hala was.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I did by the time music came in.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So we skipped ahead and wrote her theme,| then came back snuck it into this part.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Originally you met the band from Act 2 here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They "joined your party" for a bit,| and walked with you...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They also helped set up some useful background information.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And in the upcoming music segment,| they were a "marching band" with you.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Which was how that whole gameplay idea first came about.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But when I got to the lumber town,| I had no ideas for what was next for them.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So then I came back and removed them.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I felt very uncertain about the plot of Act 5 at this point.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The tone was changing so much from the start of the game,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I felt I'd lost a clear direction to move on.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I was increasingly worried I'd be alienating players.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: In retrospect,| I'm happy with all my choices.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But at the time I really couldn't see where I was going.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Things slowly started coming together for the story here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This was when I figured out that the other kingdom would be all witches.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was a hard decision to make...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I considered making them a kingdom of monsters too.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But witches fit into the existing world a lot better.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And gave me a chance to explore Miriam more...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It wasn't until MUCH later that I decided to add the Qin animals.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The people of Rulle needed something "special" on the same level as witches.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: ...|It's really embarrassing to admit how hard a time I had with this.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But it's the true story of how these things came to be.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's obvious I was losing a lot of confidence in myself here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'm really glad I didn't give up.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I kept a notebook for each act in the game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I would sketch characters, write plot ideas, note down bugs, etc.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They're kind of a diary for each part of the game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Looking back on act 5,| all I remember is how much I struggled on it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I was surprised to find on the first page of the notebook...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: All the key plot points I'd noted had translated almost 1:1 to the game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was all the details and in-between parts that I'd struggled with!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This whole city was one of those in-between parts.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I knew the bard would deliver their message to the king.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I had no idea what would happen between arriving here and that.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The Hero/potion plot came together only bit by bit.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And even when I had the idea,| I wasn't sure if it was right.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was only in the process of writing through it...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That I found the ways it would connect to Miriam, and future game events.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I researched Chinese a little bit to name Xiatian.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This part of the game has a "sun" theme...| and act 5 in general is kind of "sky"...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I put together words to make "Xiantian," which means roughly "under the sun."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I tested it on my roommate Jaymee,| who knows some Chinese (and voiced the Hero...!)

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: She told me that what I came up with was basically just the Chinese word for summer.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So,| go figure.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I hope it doesn't sound too basic in Chinese to fluent folks.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I actually first implemented the leaves for this bit.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Then went back and added them to act 2.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'd had them in mind for a long time as a wind-themed toy for act 2...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And because they were wind-themed,| they should have stayed there.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I broke my rules by putting them here...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But when I had the idea for the old lady and the flower,| I was too inspired.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Allowing myself to break my rules helped me get over my creative block with this act too.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The theming isn't as strong as a result...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But in this case the theming was hurting more than helping.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Does this room look familiar?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Every Overseer castle starts with a room like this.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But after the first Overseer dies,| stuff from the spirit world starts sneaking into the real world.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It happened with the gears/machinery in Act 4 too.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wrote the melody and lyrics for the Message to the King.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I don't know why,| but I was inspired by the original Teen Titans cartoon theme.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Spell Squad!!!!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Act 5 was supposed to have kind of a "sun and moon" theme.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But we had a lot more fun with the "moon" side.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Hence these cool gals...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They're like...|| Sailor Moon!|| {shake}GET IT???{/shake}

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wasn't really excited to do a battle here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It felt like a stretch to ask the bard to be in something like this.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I also knew that the game wanted to keep venturing in this direction.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I had to let it change, slowly.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Even so...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I actually made it possible for players to get through this sequence without doing anything.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So they wouldn't have to participate in the violence.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Besides "sun and moon"...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Another theme idea we discussed for act 5 was "smoke and mirrors."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But we had a lot more fun with mirrors,| in terms of visuals and audio and story.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Not as much with gameplay...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We could have done some puzzles with reflected song directions...| or echoes...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But that also feels too technical for this game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The idea for the band you record a song for...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Had been floating in my mind for a long time.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It felt like one of those things that we just had to have.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But when I got this far,| and started to see the path of the rest of the game,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I realized I was running out of time to use it!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So it landed here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This part also took a lot of visual inspiration from the boat in "Over the Garden Wall."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Fernando was based on a friend of a friend.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was sent an actual YouTube video of him playing accordion on stage...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And then dunk-shattering it, and lighting it on fire.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The idea was such a riot!!| So I just took it wholesale.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Mohabumi!!!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It means "magic earth" in Hindi.| My friend Divya helped me come up with it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's very fun to say.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was Hollow Knight that gave me the idea to try making a Metroidvania here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'd made one before,| and it was some of the most fun I'd had making a game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I was eager to try combining the structure with Wandersong.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'm really happy with the result!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The spell songs were a totally natural fit.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: When I explain Wandersong to gamers,| they often think this is how the whole game works.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Because it's the only way it's been done in other popular games.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I enjoyed working up to it over hours and hours of other ideas.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I gave myself a lot of constraints to keep the design simple.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Otherwise it would have been too easy to go wild with levels here...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I liked the idea for 1 "prop" that you learn different ways to manipulate.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It kept things fairly clean and elegant.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: One of the coolest moments in Metroidvanias is when you get a new ability...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And it totally transforms the way you see old screens.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This preserved that "a-ha" feeling without needing to introduce lots of different props.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It took some trial and error to ensure you couldn't break stuff by using an unexpected song in some places...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This screen was the reason I implemented dancing.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: At first the bard just had one little move they would do here only.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But then I started to get big ideas...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Dancing was just too much fun and too good a fit to keep only here.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The moment you share with Miriam is what really makes this special,| anyway.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It took me a long time to work up the courage to write it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think I was partway into Act 6 before I came bAck to fill it in...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I did most of Miriam's Mohabumi text in one very inspired day.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Since Act 5 has a lot to do with knowledge & information,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: and truth and lies...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I did a lot of stuff with "eyes" and obfuscation as well.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'm sure nobody noticed,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But with almost no exception...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Everyone in Rulle has two visible eyes,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And everyone in Chaandesh has something obfuscating their eyes,| often glasses.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: To build on that,| I thought about making the Queen blind...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Maybe a bit on the nose...| but it also tied into the spirit world connection

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: (The Moon Overseer never really appears in game,| but they were to be a bat).

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But after some tries I ended up removing that angle.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It would have been cool to have that representation and conversation...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But there was too much other stuff going on in the story to give her disability proper framing and time and respect.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It may as well be canon,| but it never comes up.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This is probably my favorite song in the game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I gave Gord the Ducktales Moon theme and Slow Magic as references.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And then he went and did something not like either of those things at all...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But in the long run,| way better than I could have expected.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We also started having fun using my Omnichord for sound design.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Try turning down the music a bit and tap dancing here...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Something deep inside me is crazy about the way lights collide with things in this spirit world.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I've tried a few times to make a puzzle game using the same concept.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I dunno,| it just tickles my brain.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This is probably the part of the game I most often came back to when absentmindedly testing.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: My very early notes for this spirit world talked about "alternate reality bubbles"...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Trying to find ways to marry "truth and lies" with "light and dark."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The idea may have been that you activate bubbles to reveal little alternate realities...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I've seen similiar ideas in other games before.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But in practice this idea came a lot more easily.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And it feels very free and floaty,| which I love for this part.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Ther anxious thinky bits come later.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Where the last part was open,| and free,| and floaty...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This part is very very dense, and anxious...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It feels like the entire screen is nothing but obstruction.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's amazing how boring this part would be if you could just see the level.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: As a game designer,| it felt like cheating.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Designing good stealth is really hard.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I kept it very minimal,| and not the only focus.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Interestingly,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: My friends Matt & Noel put a very similiar section in their game Celeste.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They happen at similiar points in the story,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We were working on them at around the same time,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And we both independently had the idea.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think there's something universal-feeling about this gameplay.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We both were really interested in how changing the game structure changed the feelings of the game...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And how that worked as a kind of storytelling element.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had a hard time getting the chase to feel right.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: For a while it was pretty crappy.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The stuff it needed basically came down to aesthetic.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Making the monster feel close...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Adding lots of static and screenshake...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The long flat run at the end is kind of a cheat too.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It all feels much more intense than it "is."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That's movie magic for you!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Ending this act was really difficult.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The stage and conflict were so huge...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'd had it in my head that it just had to end with a huge war...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Or like,| two armies rising against each other,| or something.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But practically speaking that would be very very hard to depict...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'm just one guy!!!!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Not to mention that once the emotional stakes were raised that high,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was that much more daunting to resolve the conflict

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: ...in a way that felt "fair" and emotionally honest.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So basically I panicked and procrastinated.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was this huge elephant in the room,| hanging over me the entire act.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And then when I got to this point...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was just,| like...| well...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Maybe I should try just using assets I have already...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: See how it feels...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And yeah it worked fine.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: If you didn't have ludicrous expectations built up in your head,| like I did.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I worried over nothing.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Let that be a lesson to you and I.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The bard climbs a mountain.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That's what I wrote on one of the first few pages of notes for this game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I was really inspired by the game Journey...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wanted to try marrying that game with Wandersong.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But of course our final result came out very different.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I spent on time on Google Earth and Wikipedia researching mountains.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This area was based on "Namche Bazaar,"

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The last little bit of civilization at the foot of Mt. Everest.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This was the very last screen I finished in the game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Not for any good reason.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I couldn't find any references I liked,| so I skipped over it...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Then forgot about it until the very end.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had climbed some mountains of my own on my bike,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I felt I understood the mountain climber "vibe"...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And my friends were making Celeste at the same time.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was interesting to think about our different depictions of "climbing a mountain"...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I designed these "nets" thinking they'd be a move for the boss at the end of the act.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They'd trap one of the player characters inside...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And you'd have to free them!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I also tried using the birds as an element in that battle too,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: As a way to get around.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But none of that worked or mixed together at all.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Initially I animated the birds frame by frame,| as I do most characters.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But for non-human characters,| the choppy animation style of this game really sucks the life out.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Or I lack the skill to make it work.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I ended up re-making the birds with a sort of advanced "skeleton" of pieces that move with code.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That way their movements are smooth and lifelike.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They're using the same "skeleton" system I designed for the intermission bird boss.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Which then got used for other big creatures,| like the end of act 6&7 bosses.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But for some cases it was too intensive to render the skeleon animations.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So they switch to the old frames...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The appearance is noticably different is you look closely.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: You can see the frames inside this bubble, but they become "advanced" after it breaks.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I added the bard's text to the troll way after the fact.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wanted most of Act 6 to pass by without text...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: To really emphasize "universal language," communicating with animals.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But EVERYONE thought this was the troll from act 2.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I felt it was important to clarify, so players' feelings weren't hurt.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Now it kinda serves as a "transition" moment from speech to pantomime.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Act 6 is kind of about the sequence of "partners" you have.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Judging from my sketches,| I had a lot of ideas for big strong animals...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But once I thought of the bugs,| there was no turning back.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'd go so far as to say their story is one of the most important in the game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So...| This bit does go a bit long,| but I wanted it to be as annoying as possible.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wanted some people to get exasperated with the bard,| like...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: {shake}"Just step on them!!! Sheesh!"

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This bit was very cathartic for me to make.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Because...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I'm actually terrified of bugs.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I challenged myself to use that and feel it while making this part.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Like...| making them really creepy-crawly...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But also somehow cute...| and friendly!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: In the end,| this game wants to promote the idea of universal love.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So if players could learn to love something creepy and gross,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Like I did...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Then that's a job well done.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: In the game "Night in the Woods"...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: There's a happy little computer shark character named Sharkle.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I did his happy little voice.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Em really wanted to bring a similiar dopey character to the sky seals.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So the voice I did for them kind of evokes that...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This screen is very inspired by Celeste.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Chapter 4,| the windy one,| is my favorite one visually.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I love the epic feeling of walking through the wind.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's a bit like the end of Journey too.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We didn't do it nearly as well,| but there it is.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This scene was a huge one I envisioned from early on.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The game just had to have a moment like this,| didn't it?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Once I sat down to actually write it...| I was surprised to find Audrey quite tough.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Even in the face of death,| she has a really hard time opening up.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think she has a lot of motivating factors that she'd never bring up.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This was my last chance to be silly for the whole game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I really soaked it in.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Like warming up by a fire before rushing off into a snowstorm.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I think the Heart Fairy is just so great.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I talked Gord into making the song with dog barks.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And we even worked her melody into the boss song.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This boss was pretty atrociously bad for a while.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had a million ideas for it and threw them all together and they did not mix.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: There was a much more complicated layout with lots of platforms the wolf jumped between.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And Audrey would pathfind around and try to shoot him...| it was a mess.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And every element had different "gameplay."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: You had to match notes with Audrey to charge her sword,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Guide the direction of a bird to fly around the battlefield,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And sing to break open bubbles the wolf would trap you and Audrey in...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It sounds really "epic!" but wow it was so so bad.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I ended up giving up and moving on.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After designing Act 7,| I felt I had a better understanding of how to make the boss work.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So I came back and started from scratch,| with the "shield" concept.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Narrowing it to one "verb" made it feel a LOT cooler.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Which might be counter-intuitive,| but it's true.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I also felt it important to angle the bard as a "protector" in this fight.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: To differentiate them from Audrey, who is the attacker.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Having the player character as an emphatically "supporting" role in the game conflict...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Well,| it felt just right for Wandersong.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: For this screen,| I took the very first screen in the game...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And flipped it.| Whoa!!!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I like thinking about how different directions of progression feel in a side-scroller like this.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Because of the classics,| going right feels "right."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So sending the player "left" has a different feeling to it,| which I really enjoy.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I don't know about you...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But for me,| going back to these old levels and apocalypse-ing them was pretty...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Whoah.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The falling stars in the background were another fun touch from Act 1.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: You see stars falling like that all the time in the spirit world.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But now,| they're in the "real world"...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And they're not just a pretty background...!| They actually hit the ground and explode!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's all getting a bit too real,| hmm?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This screen was directly inspired by my favorite bit of Celeste.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The dream before chapter 6,| where you fly up with feathers...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I worked closely with Gord to make a song that built up as you climbed.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I knew from early on that I wanted the Roi des Rêves to be the "final boss."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But the form that fight took changed many times in my head.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I thought the final encounter might be the bard pleading alone against the Roi des Rêves,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Using the power of song to convince him back to the light.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But the story grew many layers by the time I got here...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And Audrey stole the show as the obvious antagonist.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Still,| I enjoy thinking about the fight from that perspective.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: If this is really Audrey's game,| then the Roi des Rêves really IS the final boss.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And your mission in the end is to help the final boss win.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: My early ideas for the battle suffered the same as my first try on the Act 6 boss.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Every attack was a different game mechanic,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Nothing overlapped,| and the result was a mess.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Because the battle represents such a pivotal moment in the story...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was tempting to throw every idea at it to make it "epic".

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I quickly realized it was more important to make it feel good.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The falling stars were the coolest-feeling attack,| so I honed in on those.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I tried extending the idea with the plants.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: They follow your singing in a similar way, but you have to aim them differently.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And only after several playtests did I have the idea for Audrey hitting back stars.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I wanted her to feel surprising and alive and adaptive,| like a human player.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This concept for an "end of the world" came 100% from Em.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After playing with music and color for the whole game it seemed like a very apt idea.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: After every Overseer death we desaturated the colors and removed sounds to foreshadow this...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Silence was always our symbol for "The End"

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: This is what it all builds up to.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We had many discussions throughout development on how to execute this.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The core concept was always the same...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The bard starts singing alone,| and one by one characters join in from across the game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: For a long time we thought it would become the "real" Earthsong when everyone came together.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And at that point,| it would "evolve" into just noise and sounds...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Because it was too "pure" to grasp the true form of,| like the face of god.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But it felt a little more achievable when I decided it wouldn't "actually" "be" the Earthsong.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It's just a good try at it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That way we could be comfortable rendering something "accurate."

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I find the message at the end way stronger as well.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: As far as the specific gameplay,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had no idea what it would be until we got this far.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: (I'm sure that's no surprise if you've been reading these up to now).

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The idea to use the end of act instruments was very obvious,| in retrospect.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But at the time it was a huge epiphany.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It was also good because I didn't have to think of much new stuff.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I got to focus on refining the gameplay and making it feel nice,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Without the pressure of coming up with new ideas.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And all my work here also improved the instrument sections in previous acts.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: The commentary itself was a very last moment decision.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: I had the idea and we wrote it all in the last couple weeks of the project.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: It felt a bit self-centered to fill the game with my voice like this...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: But I also very fondly remember digging into commentary by other artists I love.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: And I wanted to use the opportunity to clue people into the process a bit.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We tried to make the path for unlocking it very obtuse,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So that players would generally have to look it up to find it.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: That way,| they had already mentally "left" the world of the game,

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: So we could do something meta without breaking the experience for players who enjoy the illusion.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Commentary on our design decision to put commentary into the game...

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: We're probably at about peak meta,| aren't we?

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Fitting for the "final" commentary in the game.

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: Thanks for playing!

SPEAKER: objCommentary
ENGLISH: {color red}0
